snippet: The British government agency in charge of managing the holdings in the country’s bailed-out banks has appointed James Leigh Pemberton, a former Credit Suisse banker, as its new chief executive.
abstract: The British government agency in charge of managing the holdings in the country’s bailed-out banks has appointed James Leigh Pemberton, a former Credit Suisse banker, as its new chief executive.

headline.main: British Agency Appoints New Chief to Oversee Bailout Investments
